title: Augusta: Amanda C. Armentrout to William F. Brand, June 3, 1866
summary: Kate pleads with Willie to forgive her while recounting the story of the Biblical serpent who led good Christians astray and away from the Lord. She says that she was wrong to accuse Willie of acting wrongly by operating a distillery and drinking.
keywords: Home Front, Women, Church/Religious Activity, Family, American Civil War
